Title: Admin can view all products with full details and inventory status
Description: Verify that the admin can retrieve a list of all products with all details and inventory status using the GET /api/products endpoint.
Acceptance_Criteria: All products are listed with complete details (id, name, description, price, category, stockQuantity).
Inventory status is visible for each product.

Steps: Send GET request to /api/products as admin.
Verify 200 OK response.
Verify response contains array of products with all fields populated.
Test_Scenarios.Expected_Result: All products returned with full details and inventory status.

Steps: Send GET request to /api/products as non-admin user.
Send GET request without authentication.
Test_Scenarios.Expected_Result: Access denied (401/403) for unauthorized users.

Steps: Send GET request to /api/products with a large product catalog (e.g., 10,000 products).
Test_Scenarios.Expected_Result: Response time is within performance SLA (e.g., < 2s).

Title: Admin can add a new product with details
Description: Verify that admin can create a new product with all required fields using POST /api/products.
Acceptance_Criteria: Admin can add product with name, description, price, category, images.
Product appears in product list after creation.

Steps: Send POST request with valid product payload (all required fields).
Test_Scenarios.Expected_Result: 201 Created, product returned with correct fields.

Steps: Send POST request with missing required fields.
Send POST request with invalid field types (e.g., price as string).
Test_Scenarios.Expected_Result: 400 Bad Request with ErrorResponse schema.

Steps: Send POST request with minimum allowed values (e.g., price=0).
Send POST request with maximum allowed values (e.g., max length name/description).
Test_Scenarios.Expected_Result: 201 Created if within limits, 400 if exceeding.

Steps: Send POST request with boundary values for price, stockQuantity, and string lengths.
Test_Scenarios.Expected_Result: Accepted for valid boundaries, rejected for out-of-bounds.

Steps: Send POST request as non-admin.
Send POST request with invalid/missing auth token.
Test_Scenarios.Expected_Result: 401/403 Unauthorized.

Title: Admin can update product details
Description: Verify that admin can update product fields using PUT /api/products/{id}.
Acceptance_Criteria: Admin can update any product field (name, description, price, category, images).
Updated product is reflected in GET /api/products.

Steps: Send PUT request with valid updates to existing product ID.
Test_Scenarios.Expected_Result: 200 OK, product updated as requested.

Steps: Send PUT request with invalid product ID.
Send PUT request with invalid field values.
Test_Scenarios.Expected_Result: 404 Not Found for invalid ID, 400 Bad Request for invalid data.

Steps: Send PUT request updating only one field.
Send PUT request with empty strings for optional fields.
Test_Scenarios.Expected_Result: 200 OK if valid, 400 if not.

Steps: Send PUT request with boundary values for all updatable fields.
Test_Scenarios.Expected_Result: Accepted for valid boundaries, rejected for out-of-bounds.

Steps: Send PUT request as non-admin.
Send PUT request without authentication.
Test_Scenarios.Expected_Result: 401/403 Unauthorized.

Title: Admin can delete a product (mark as inactive or remove from DB)
Description: Verify that admin can delete a product using DELETE /api/products/{id}, and that product is either marked as inactive or removed.
Acceptance_Criteria: Admin can delete product by ID.
Deleted product is not returned in GET /api/products.

Steps: Send DELETE request for existing product ID.
Test_Scenarios.Expected_Result: 200 OK or 204 No Content, product no longer visible in product list.

Steps: Send DELETE request for non-existent product ID.
Test_Scenarios.Expected_Result: 404 Not Found.

Steps: Send DELETE request as non-admin.
Send DELETE request without authentication.
Test_Scenarios.Expected_Result: 401/403 Unauthorized.

Title: Admin can update inventory levels
Description: Verify that admin can update the inventory (stockQuantity) for a product using PUT /api/products/{id}.
Acceptance_Criteria: Inventory change is reflected in GET /api/products.

Steps: Send PUT request to update stockQuantity for a product.
Test_Scenarios.Expected_Result: 200 OK, updated stockQuantity reflected.

Steps: Send PUT request with negative stockQuantity.
Send PUT request with stockQuantity as non-integer.
Test_Scenarios.Expected_Result: 400 Bad Request.

Steps: Send PUT request with stockQuantity = 0.
Send PUT request with very large stockQuantity.
Test_Scenarios.Expected_Result: Accepted if within limits, rejected if exceeding allowed range.

Steps: Send PUT request with stockQuantity at min/max allowed values.
Test_Scenarios.Expected_Result: Accepted for valid boundaries, rejected otherwise.

Steps: Send PUT request to update stockQuantity as non-admin.
Send PUT request without authentication.
Test_Scenarios.Expected_Result: 401/403 Unauthorized.

Title: Product search and category filtering
Description: Verify that products can be searched and filtered by category using /api/products/search and /api/products/category/{category}.
Acceptance_Criteria: Products are correctly filtered and searchable by name, description, or category.

Steps: Send GET request to /api/products/search with valid query.
Send GET request to /api/products/category/{category} with existing category.
Test_Scenarios.Expected_Result: 200 OK, correct filtered product list returned.

Steps: Send GET request with invalid or non-existing category.
Send search with special characters or SQL keywords.
Test_Scenarios.Expected_Result: Empty list or 400 Bad Request (no injection/exploit).

Steps: Send search with min/max query length.
Send filter with category at max allowed length.
Test_Scenarios.Expected_Result: Accepted if within limits, rejected if not.

Steps: Send search/filter with boundary input values.
Test_Scenarios.Expected_Result: Accepted for valid boundaries, rejected otherwise.

Steps: Send search/filter requests under high load and with large datasets.
Test_Scenarios.Expected_Result: Response time within SLA, system remains stable.

Title: Error handling validation
Description: Verify that the API returns the ErrorResponse schema for invalid operations.
Acceptance_Criteria: ErrorResponse is returned with appropriate error codes and messages for all error conditions.

Steps: Send requests with malformed payloads.
Send requests with missing required parameters.
Test_Scenarios.Expected_Result: ErrorResponse returned with 400 or 422 status.

Steps: Send requests with invalid or expired tokens.
Send requests with insufficient privileges.
Test_Scenarios.Expected_Result: ErrorResponse with 401/403 status.
